page.title: 09HOUSING IN MAWNAN
page.content: Mawnan was primarily an agriciltural community of isolated farms.Houses were built on the crossroads.The village became known as Mawnan Smith after the 4{Blacksmiths}who worked there.Today there is 1 who is semi-retired.The old houses are made of{cob}which is mud,stone and lime.Most of these have been renovated few have thatched roofs.The village expanded,ribbon development mainly of {bunglows}spread out from the centre of the village.Two{council estates}were built for the local people before and after the war.As land became more expensive estates of bunglows were built.The most recent addition is a large estate of houses, mostly semi-detached, to cater for youger families who are employed in Truro or Falmouth.Most people own their own houses.
